translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

Certain of the government’s refined patriotism and distinguished adherence to the cause in which the valiant people of Rio Grande are engaged, it charges you with the agency of the monthly subscription decreed on the past 10th of November, as well as in the authentic board, for the urgencies of the present struggle for our independence; and counts on Your Lordship

The proceeds of said subscription will be sent to the Inspector of the National Treasury in this city. May God keep Your Lordship

Secretariat of the State of the Interior and Finance Affairs in Piratini, 14th of September, 1837.

Domingos José de Almeida.

Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães, Boqueirão. From the Ministry of the Interior and Finance. Received on 28th of September, 1837.
